TopicTitle: Controlling maneuver node placement: focus the view on a nearby temporary node!

Articles.Content: I'm probably the last guy at the party, but if the view isn't focused on a maneuver node, dragging it around is easy-peasy-puddn'n'pie. So to fine-tune a node, drop a temporary one right next to it, tab the focus around to that, and have your way with the real one. I feel so much better now.

Hello. I hear there's a party?

Maybe I'm the last one to get here, but I didn't know that. Thanks!
And once I have precise node, I can't live without it... you can still focus on your target when doing really fine adjustments. Not to mention you can directly type the value of dV...
